Class Campus

  • java.lang.Object
    • Campus
  • public class Campus
    A Campus consists of multiple dorms and guests checking In and Out.
    Version:
    August 20, 2019
    Author:
    Arshdeep Singh, Mayur Jartarkar

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int dormCount
      Represents the number of Dorms in the Campus.
      private Dorm[] dormList
      Represents an array containing objects of Dorm class.
      (package private) static int MAX_DORMS
      Represents a final static int that reoresents the maximum number of dorms that can be there in Campus.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Campus()
      Constructor for Campus Class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean addDorm​(int capacity)
      Adds a dorm object to the Campus.
      boolean checkIn()
      Checks in a new guest to the first dorm according to their index which is empty.
      boolean checkIn​(int index)
      Checks in a new guest to the dorm whose index is given.
      boolean checkOut​(int index)
      Checks out a existing guest from the dorm whose index is given.
      int getFurnitureCount()
      Return the total furniture count in all dorms.
      boolean insertFurniture​(int index, java.lang.String furniture)
      Adds a new furniture to a particular dorm object of the Campus.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • dormCount

        private int dormCount
        Represents the number of Dorms in the Campus.

      • MAX_DORMS

        static final int MAX_DORMS
        Represents a final static int that reoresents the maximum number of dorms that can be there in Campus. The value is equal to 10.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • dormList

        private Dorm[] dormList
        Represents an array containing objects of Dorm class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Campus

        public Campus()
        Constructor for Campus Class. It is used to initilaze the dormList array with MAX_DORMS dorms. It also initilazes the dormCount to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • addDorm

        public boolean addDorm​(int capacity)
        Adds a dorm object to the Campus.
        Parameters:
        capacity - integer representing the capacity of the dorm to be added.
        Returns:
        boolean true if dorm is added successfully else false.

      • getFurnitureCount

        public int getFurnitureCount()
        Return the total furniture count in all dorms.
        Returns:
        integer representing total furniture count.

      • insertFurniture

        public boolean insertFurniture​(int index,
                               java.lang.String furniture)
        Adds a new furniture to a particular dorm object of the Campus.
        Parameters:
        index - integer representing the index of the dorm to which furniture has to be added.
        furniture - string representing the furniture that is to be added.
        Returns:
        boolean true if furniture is added successfully else false.

      • checkIn

        public boolean checkIn()
        Checks in a new guest to the first dorm according to their index which is empty.
        Returns:
        boolean true if guest is added successfully else false.

      • checkIn

        public boolean checkIn​(int index)
        Checks in a new guest to the dorm whose index is given.
        Parameters:
        index - integer representing index of the dorm to be added.
        Returns:
        boolean true if guest is added successfully else false.

      • checkOut

        public boolean checkOut​(int index)
        Checks out a existing guest from the dorm whose index is given.
        Parameters:
        index - integer representing index of dorm.
        Returns:
        boolean true if guest is checked out successfully else false.
